Geography: China (cultivated in different parts of China; 中國各地均有栽培)
Meridians: Heart (according to Ben Cao Cong Xin 本草從新)
Liver (according to Ben Cao Cong Xin 本草從新)
Kidney (according to Yu Qiu Yao Lun 玉楸药論)
Maladies Treated: Pain and swelling of throat (咽喉腫痛)
Sores and carbuncles with swelling and pain (瘡癰腫痛)
Difficulty in urination (小便不利／小便不通)
Medical Function: Clears heat and toxin (清熱解毒)
Dosage: Internal: decoction 3–6 g. External: appropriate amount, smash and apply. 內服：煎湯，3-6g。外用：適量，搗敷。
Samples of Formulae:
For swollen throat (治咽喉腫痛): Yu Zan Hua (Hosta flower) 3 g, Ban Lan Gen (Isatis root) 15 g, Xuan Shen (Figwort root) 15 g. Boil with water and take as tea. Source: 《山東中草藥手冊》.

For difficulty in urination (治小便不通): Formula I — Name: Yu Long San (Jade Dragon Powder) 《醫學指南》玉龍散. Composition: Yu Zan Hua (Hosta flower) 6 g, She Tui (Snake slough) 6 g, Ding Xiang (Clove) 3 g. Make into powder. Use 3 g each time. Stir with rice wine and take orally.

For difficulty in urination (治小便不通): Formula II — Composition: Yu Zan Hua (Hosta flower) 3 g, Bian Xu (Knotgrass herb) 12 g, Che Qian Cao (Plantain herb) 12 g, Deng Xin Cao (Rush pith) 3 g. Boil with water and take as tea. Source: 《山東中草藥手冊》。
Contraindications: The whole plant is toxic (玉簪全株有毒). It can damage the teeth and can cause the teeth to fall off (可損傷牙齒而致牙齒脫落).
Research:
Anti-tumor effect: Root of Yu Zan Hua water extract, tested in whole animal experiments, showed a high degree of anti-tumor activity against Ehrlich ascites tumor cells; the anti-tumor active ingredient is a polymer. Using Yu Zan Hua alcohol extract at 0.25 g/kg by oral or intraperitoneal administration, for six consecutive days, showed inhibition of murine leukemia L615 with an inhibition rate of 28.5%. [1]

Reported pharmacological activities: anti-inflammatory; anti-acetylcholinesterase; anti-viral; antifungal; insecticidal activity. [2]

Chemical study findings: From various parts of Yu Zan Hua, strong inhibitory effects were observed against common bacterial strains. A total of 14 compounds were isolated from various parts, and 11 compounds (H1–H11) were structurally identified. Conclusion: all compounds were obtained for the first time from this species; H1, H3, H4, H5, H6, and H8 were obtained for the first time from this genus. Author: Zhang Jinhua. [1]

Additional source (journal PDF): http://www.academicjournals.org/jmpr/pdf/pdf2012/16Apr/Li%20et%20al.pdf

Geography: Red lucid ganoderma (赤芝) is produced in East China, Southwest China, Hebei, Shanxi, Jiangxi, Guangxi and Guangdong provinces.
Violet lucid ganoderma (紫芝) is produced in Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Hunan, Guangxi, Fujian and Guangdong provinces.
Maladies Treated: Tonic for lung and kidney. For syndrome caused by both lung qi deficient and shenxu (kidney deficient) including cough and asthma which become worse on exertion, shortness of breath and fatigue.
Tonic for liver and kidney. For syndrome caused by both the liver and shenxu (kidney deficient), such as tinnitus, deafness and lassitude of the loins and knees.
For calming anxiety and xinqixu (heart qi deficient) that resulting in palpitation, insomnia and amnesia.
For pixu (spleen deficient) with weak digestion.
For treatment of large B cell lymphoma [3]
Medical Function: effect of Inhibiting replicating of hepatitis B virus. [1]
Ganoderic acid causes apoptosis in leukemia, lymphoma and multiple myeloma cells. [2]
prevents neuronal loss following cerebral ischemia
protects dopaminergic neuron degeneration through Inhibition of microglial activation [3]
Dosage:
每日量，作煎剂：3∼10 克。
3-10 g daily decocted in water.
Contraindications:
It is contraindicated in patients at the onset of the exopathic diseases.
Not to use in large amount or long term usage in patients with kidney stones, or with diabetes or hypertension because of oxalic acid. Drink large amount of water to prevent forming of oxalate.

Geography: native to certain areas in the Sierra Mazateca of Oaxaca, Mexico
Medical Function: Salvinorin A is capable of inhibiting excess intestinal motility, thus stopping diarrhea.
In folk medicine at low dosage as a diuretic.
Mazatec shamans use it for spiritual healing.
Contraindications: This herb is not legal in some parts of the world and also in some states in U.S.
Research:
Salvia divinorum and Mitragyna speciosa ("Kratom"), two unscheduled dietary supplements whose active agents are opioid receptor agonists, have discrete psychoactive effects that have contributed to their increasing popularity. Salvia divinorum contains the highly selective kappa- opioid receptor agonist salvinorin A; this compound produces visual hallucinations and synesthesia. Mitragynine, the major alkaloid identified from Kratom, has been reported as a partial opioid agonist producing similar effects to morphine. An interesting minor alkaloid of Kratom, 7-hydroxymitragynine, has been reported to be more potent than morphine. Both Kratom alkaloids are reported to activate supraspinal mu- and delta- opioid receptors, explaining their use by chronic narcotics users to ameliorate opioid withdrawal symptoms.

Name: royal jelly
royal bee jelly
Biological: Apis cerana Fabr (Chinese bees, 中華蜜蜂)
Apis mellifera L. (Italian bees, 意大利蜜蜂)

Medical Function: Auxiliary medicine to lower blood sugar: contains insulin-like peptides.
Anti-oxidant effect: superoxide dismutase (SOD) is the main component of the antioxidant.
Dilates blood vessels, thus reducing blood pressure.

Protects the liver: because it contains ω-Hydroxy-2-deecnoic acid (royal jelly acid, 10-羥基－癸烯酸) as well as the major royal jelly protein-1; royal jelly can not only kill the virus, and to inhibit viral replication in the liver cells.

Anti-bacterial, anti-inflammatory: royal jelly has antibacterial and promotes wound infections healing effect. Antibacterial spectrum includes Escherichia coli, Salmonella typhi, Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus, Proteus, Bacillus subtilis, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, star dermatophytes such as Trichophyton and epidermis. Antibacterial and anti-inflammatory effect is pH related: at pH 4.5 antibacterial is strongest; at pH 7 antimicrobial is weakened; at pH 8 antibacterial disappears. Natural royal jelly pH is between 3.5–4.5, therefore, in the natural situation, it has the strongest antibacterial and anti-inflammatory effect.
Dosage: To take orally: use 50–200 mg with lukewarm boiled water. [1]
Samples of Formulae:
Treatment of acute infectious hepatitis: Oral 1% 王漿蜂蜜 (royal jelly honey; mixture of royal jelly and honey). Dosage: 4 years old and under: 5 g; 5 to 10 years old: 10 g; 10 years old and older: 20 g. 1 dose per day, make into 2 servings. 20 days is a therapy period; take it for 3 periods. [3]

Treatment of chronic rheumatoid arthritis: royal jelly 400 mg daily, taken daily for 3–6 months. [3]

Neurology treatment for progressive muscular dystrophy: 300–600 mg daily for two weeks to three months or more. Psychiatric treatment for schizophrenia, dementia, paralysis, menopausal depression, neurosis and mental retardation: start daily oral 100 mg and gradually increase to 800 mg (each up to 400 mg each time) over 6–10 weeks; total dosage 19,200–30,600 mg. [3]
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of diarrhea due to infection (濕熱瀉痢者禁服). Use with care while pregnant. Do not use while breast feeding. [1]
Research:
Clinical application – acute infectious hepatitis: Result of treatment of 22 cases: a variety of symptoms significantly improved in 3–14 days. Livers significantly shrunk in about 3 weeks. In about 10 days, serum transaminases reduced 40 units or more, or returned to normal. A variety of other laboratory tests significantly improved in 9–18 days. It had good effect in improving liver function. Adverse reactions observed in a few cases: increase of absolute eosinophilic count, sinus arrhythmia (including one case with escape), rash, diarrhea. [3]

Clinical application – chronic rheumatoid arthritis: Preliminary observations in 28 cases: significant improved (general condition improved, joint pain alleviated significantly) 7 cases; improved (general condition improved, joint pain slightly relieved) 3 cases; stabilized (the same general condition as before treatment, joint pain no improvement, but no sharp attack) 10 cases; ineffective 8 cases. Usually after serving 3–4 weeks began to show effect; a few needed 6–7 weeks to show effect. No adverse reactions were found during medication; occasional dry mouth, headache, dry stools, which resolved in the short term. [3]

Clinical application – neurology and psychiatry: Neurology – 16 cases of progressive muscular dystrophy; result: significant progress in 8 cases, mild progress in 1 case. Psychiatry – 9 cases of schizophrenia, dementia, paralysis, menopausal depression, neurosis and mental retardation; results: 1 case was obviously brightened up, 2 cases resulted in mental alert, 1 case of mental retardation became more obedient; the other five cases showed no progress. [3]
Notes:
Physical and chemical examination: (1) pH should be 3.5–4.8. (2) A halogen moisture analyzer can be used to quickly determine water content; it should not contain more than 70% of water. (3) With a lit match close to the royal jelly, there should be no brown particles melting rapidly (checking wax). Moisten a glass rod with iodine test solution, coat with a small amount of royal jelly across a white porcelain plate, then scratch with the glass rod; the scratch marks should not be obviously blue, green or red-brown (checking starch). (4) Take a little royal jelly in a test tube, dilute with a small amount of distilled water, stir, add a few drops of Fehling's reagent solution, slightly boil in water bath for 1–2 minutes, remove and examine; it should not show red or reddish brown (checking honey).

Note: Fehling's solution is an aqueous solution of copper sulfate, sodium hydroxide, and potassium sodium tartrate used to test for the presence of sugars and aldehydes in a substance, such as urine.

Biotin (生物素) is one of the B vitamins, also called vitamin H, vitamin B7, and coenzyme R (輔酶R).
